intro: Schismatoglottis pellucida, commonly known as the glassy schismatoglottis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are covered in a waxy, translucent coating, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and typically greenish-white, arranged in a dense inflorescence. Schismatoglottis pellucida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
